item.title: Opening files with Vim from the Finder on macOS
item.description: I use Vim for most all the file editing I do on my Mac. I thought it’d be nice to be able to click on files in the Finder window and have them open up in my terminal for editing with Vim, so I wrote a bit of AppleScript to make it happen. This post shares how I set this up on my Mac so that you can do the same.
